intro: Bowlesia macrosperma, commonly known as the giant sand dollar, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to dry environments. The plant produces showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. Its thick, fleshy stems store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, drought-prone conditions. Bowlesia macrosperma is often found in rocky soils and is well adapted to full sun exposure.
